title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\InstanceGroupManager
name: InstanceGroupManager
description:
Represents a Managed Instance Group resource. An instance group is a collection of VM instances that you can manage as a single entity. For more information, read Instance groups. For zonal Managed Instance Group, use the instanceGroupManagers resource. For regional Managed Instance Group, use the regionInstanceGroupManagers resource.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.InstanceGroupManager

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.auto_healing_policies
params.description: The autohealing policy for this managed instance group. You can specify only one value.

params.name: data.base_instance_name
params.description: The base instance name to use for instances in this group. The value must be 1-58 characters long. Instances are named by appending a hyphen and a random four-character string to the base instance name. The base instance name must comply with RFC1035.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] The creation timestamp for this managed instance group in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.current_actions
params.description: [Output Only] The list of instance actions and the number of instances in this managed instance group that are scheduled for each of those actions.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource.

params.name: data.distribution_policy
params.description: Policy specifying the intended distribution of managed instances across zones in a regional managed instance group.

params.name: data.fingerprint
params.description: Fingerprint of this resource. This field may be used in optimistic locking. It will be ignored when inserting an InstanceGroupManager. An up-to-date fingerprint must be provided in order to update the InstanceGroupManager, otherwise the request will fail with error 412 conditionNotMet. To see the latest fingerprint, make a get() request to retrieve an InstanceGroupManager.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] A unique identifier for this resource type. The server generates this identifier.

params.name: data.instance_group
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of the Instance Group resource.

params.name: data.instance_template
params.description: The URL of the instance template that is specified for this managed instance group. The group uses this template to create all new instances in the managed instance group. The templates for existing instances in the group do not change unless you run recreateInstances, run applyUpdatesToInstances, or set the group's updatePolicy.type to PROACTIVE.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] The resource type, which is always compute#instanceGroupManager for managed instance groups.

params.name: data.list_managed_instances_results
params.description: Pagination behavior of the listManagedInstances API method for this managed instance group. Check the ListManagedInstancesResults enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the managed instance group. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035.

params.name: data.named_ports
params.description: Named ports configured for the Instance Groups complementary to this Instance Group Manager.

params.name: data.region
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of the region where the managed instance group resides (for regional resources).

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] The URL for this managed instance group. The server defines this URL.

params.name: data.stateful_policy
params.description: Stateful configuration for this Instanced Group Manager

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output Only] The status of this managed instance group.

params.name: data.target_pools
params.description: The URLs for all TargetPool resources to which instances in the instanceGroup field are added. The target pools automatically apply to all of the instances in the managed instance group.

params.name: data.target_size
params.description: The target number of running instances for this managed instance group. You can reduce this number by using the instanceGroupManager deleteInstances or abandonInstances methods. Resizing the group also changes this number.

params.name: data.update_policy
params.description: The update policy for this managed instance group.

params.name: data.versions
params.description: Specifies the instance templates used by this managed instance group to create instances. Each version is defined by an instanceTemplate and a name. Every version can appear at most once per instance group. This field overrides the top-level instanceTemplate field. Read more about the relationships between these fields. Exactly one version must leave the targetSize field unset. That version will be applied to all remaining instances. For more information, read about canary updates.

params.name: data.zone
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of a zone where the managed instance group is located (for zonal resources).

methods.name: getVersions
methods.description:
Specifies the instance templates used by this managed instance group to create instances. Each version is defined by an instanceTemplate and a name. Every version can appear at most once per instance group. This field overrides the top-level instanceTemplate field. Read more about the relationships between these fields. Exactly one version must leave the targetSize field unset. That version will be applied to all remaining instances. For more information, read about canary updates.
